markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tidal Fishhook](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1485)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Monsters of Myth](/Sources.aspx?ID=107) pg. 107</row>

**Price** 1,700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Combat Grapnel](/Weapons.aspx?ID=139)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [returning](/Equipment.aspx?ID=301) [combat grapnel](/Weapons.aspx?ID=139)_ takes the form of a fishhook made of scavenged bones and stone with a cord of braided water. Attacks with a _tidal fishhook_ don't take any of the normal penalties for fighting underwater. A [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=2) (but not destroyed) tidal fishhook can be fully repaired by submerging it in an ocean for 1 minute.

<document level="2" id="action-1122" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Tidal Fishhook
